direction.raw_text: as he prepares to do dirty on the bird. Over his shoulder, we PUSH in to the BULLETHOLE from the first dart until we're in TIGHT CLOSE-UP of an eye watching through the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Albrecht digs through a sling bag of weaponry, trying to simultaneously monitor the peephole, muttering sotto to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Had to go get yourself hip-deep in shit, didn't you, my friend. It begins to rain.  Albrecht glances resentfully toward the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give it a rest, huh? A hefts a machinegun, clipped over and under.  CUTS LOOSE on full auto into the Madonna on the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the window EXPLODES toward Grange and he sucks big hits from behind, DROPPING the crow.  The bird hits the ground, flapping weakly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 & #4 exchange a look and whip up their Calicos,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Albrecht takes cover as a lot of religious stuff is noisily destroyed all around his position.  Chunks of the window continue to disintegrate. INT. CHURCH ALTER (NIGHT) Eric tuck-and-rolls out of the way as we go CLOSE on Lao, screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said no shooting! Then he's ducking bullets himself as Albrecht STEPS IN through the blown out window, the machine gun stuttering on slugs. The sanctuary comes apart around Lao.  He RETREATS to the alter and EXITS whence he came.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: just as Guard #4 comes after him with the sword, which chomps into the wood and gets stuck there. Guard #4 releases it and cross draws his Calico as ERIC springs back into the frame -- STRAIGHT UP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #4 as Eric's lancing foot propels him backward before he can fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 scrambling to reload.  Guard changes magazine; Albrecht swaps clips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guard #4 slides.  Sits up with his gun as Eric, down-pew, grabs the sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: firing now with a gun in each hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #4, who eats it from Albrecht's gunfire, but not before he puts a round through Eric. Eric staggers back from the impact but keeps his feet. RESUME ALBRECHT as he tosses away the dry pistol.  His machine gun jams, he fights to get the clip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 -- reloaded and rising, having caught Albrecht dead-bang in the open by the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE - WITH ERIC --  A complex leap with the sword flashing.  He lands near Guard #3 and SLASHES UPWARDS, blade up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP - GUARD #3 -- screaming in pain, gaping DOWN O.S.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - looking UP, following the trajectory of something AIRBORNE toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP - GUARD #3'S Calico spinning mid-air with Guard #3s
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still attached, severed mid-forearm by Eric's devastating strike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: drops Guard #3 -- to REVEAL Eric in the background.  Eric salutes Albrecht with the tip of the sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he moves into the nave, which has been torn apart by gunfire.  Hazy smoke.  Two dead guys.  And Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sorta looked like you might need my help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't your place.  This isn't your fight.  And I don't need your help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave here.  Don't do this.  I don't want you here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hell you say.  This isn't just about you any more. Eric stares dead-on at Albrecht, acidly, then BREAKS the Guard's sword, dropping the pieces and turning his back on Albrecht, who pursues Eric to: INT. SPIRAL STAIRCASE - TO BELL TOWER - NIGHT The crow FLAPS UPWARD through the void.  Eric grabs the thick bellrope, testing it.  A final look to Albrecht.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't interfere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're bleeding, man.  You can't make it. Eric shinnies up the bellrope, ignoring Albrecht.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watching as Eric dissappears from view, fast..  Grumbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't mind if I just take the stairs, then, smartass... He hefts his arsenal bag of hardware and begins to plod up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A weird perspective of speed climb.  Zip!  All the way to the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CHURCH ROOF - NIGHT Slanted, shingled, slippery, dark.  Lightning deep in the turbid clouds.  The crow circles as Eric RISES INTO FRAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lightning STRIKES the ornate LIGHTNING ROD (large, Victorian, lance-like) at the far end of the roof from the bell tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lao and Elly standing in front of it.  Elly flinches at the strike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you fly, Crow man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops his ascent to light a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't cut out for this superhero shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lao SNAPS Elly's free handcuff to the dimly glowing  lightning rod and advances, one foot on either side of the peak of the roof, his blade brandished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: MOVING SHOT - ERIC -- Hands up to grapple, but weaponless.  He spiders to meet Lao, suddenly PICKING UP SPEED and RUNNING along the precarious peak. Lao sees him coming, braces to strike, but Eric executes a BROAD FLYING LEAP right over Lao's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sprawls sideways, clinging to the peak of the roof.  Lao hurries in to slash with the blade, as Eric averts. The steel RINGS.  Eric converts his dodge into a low spin kick that DUMPS Lao. Eric SPREAD-EAGLES to keep from falling.  Distantly, Lao similarly saves himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- THE FIGHT -- Here comes Lao, crabbing back toward the peak.  Eric ROLLS to Elly's position, GRABS the lightning rod and tries to wrest it loose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Eric's hands are scorched: the metal is still blue-hot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Eric battles to free the lightning rod.  Lao closes up distance, gives a warcry and prepares to swing as - Eric WRENCHES the rod loose and turns to deflect Lao's blow. The weapons spark as they meet... and there goes Elly, her handcuff freed, SLIDING DOWN THE ROOF SLOPE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- ROOF SLOPE -- WITH ERIC  as he dodges Lao by using the lightning rod to vault down to where Elly is about to slip off the roof. With the rod embedded in the roof, Eric hangs on, and elly hangs on to Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- LAO, a dark figure against the night sky, raising the sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Face me! Eric guides Elly to the top of one of the flying buttresses. When he looks up, Lao is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Albrecht's head pokes up at last.  Looks around, finally spots Eric below and to the left.  YELLS, serio-comic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he dead yet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Lao's hand draws Albrecht's gun quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Lao has blindsided Albrecht.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  You are. He jams the gun into the base of ALbrecht's neck and fires three times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - He's too far away to matter.  Shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as it rolls down the slope, trailing sparks, snuffing out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holding onto the lightning rod as lightning CUTS the night above him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- LAO AT BELL TOWER, triumphant and a bit wild, SHOUTING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've caused another death, Mister Draven!  The girl will die as well -- because of you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The base of a triangle - Lao, Eric, Elly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You go to hell, you pervert!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rage over the loss of Albrecht.  He RISES, hurting but mad as hell.  GLARES UP toward Lao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And how many lives have you destroyed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took yours from you.  Your little girlfriend?  I took hers, too.  Your meaningless, petty life?  I took it so that tonight your existence might gain a purpose.  You're no avenger. You're mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Eyes alight with hatred for Lao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right, I'm not an avenger. Not any more. As lightning strikes, Eric Fires his gaze TOWARD THE SKY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - ("CROWVISION")
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the crash dive toward Lao through the row's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the crow wings down INTO FRAME and lights on Lao's head, CLAWING!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP -- THE CROW ON LAO'S HEAD slashing with its claws. Pecking out Lao's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the roofslope as he totters but maintains his climb, the crow/Lao UPFRAME B.G.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the crow abandons him.  Lao STAGGERS AND FALLS down the roof - toward Eric.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -- ERIC AND LAO -- Eric ARRESTS Lao's fall, fisting lapels and bringing him nose to nose.  Fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time for a sacrifice. Lao's face is a hideous bloody mask with black holes where the eyes used to be.  He smiles gruesomely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need eyes to take what I want from you. He EMBRACES Eric and RAMS the killing blade deep into Eric's back!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he looks down to see the blade protruding from his sternum.  Tight grimace.  A lot of pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you fly? He pulls Lao into a BACKWARD ROLL down the roof, HOLDING HIM TIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE -- INTERCUTS -- ERIC AND LAO FALL Eric lands on his back, forcing the blade THROUGH himself and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lao.  Eric completes the roll and KICKS Lao off INTO SPACE, the killing blade still embedded in him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as crashes, sliding, sprawling down PAST Elly's position.  Gets to his knees atop the flying buttress.  Sees the blade in his own chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP - ELLY - she sees it all happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - a regretful look toward Eric.  He PLUMMETS off the roof edge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slows, stopping when Elly is in frame.  He clutches his own chest.  Regards his own shaking hand, drenched in his won blood.  Glazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as she finally gets the duct tape off her mouth, trying to get to Eric.  She flails and cries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't let me fall!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP -- their hands finally meet and GRASP TIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (RAIN) A low angle TRACKING SHOT (as when we first met Elly). Eric's and Elly's feet pass graves.  Eric's pace is slow, crippled, limping.  They STOP at a grave where elly BENDS INTO FRAME to steal the flowers there. Eric is bloody and out of it.  She helps him walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now do you get to see her? Shelly, I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a better place.  I hope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not gonna come back, are you? Eric's response is halting and uncertain.  But he tries to give her hope.  He reaches for Shelly's ring around her neck, holds it up to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if I can.  But you have this... and you know where to come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean you'll, like' dig your way out of the grave?  Euww. Eric is amused by this in spite of his grievous injuries. He grasps Elly's face in his hands and bends, painfully,to kiss her on the forehead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For you, I'll try.  Promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spent, empty, he holds the rose determinedly, but he's never going to make it the few yards back to his own grave.  So close. His legs finally go and he collapses onto the humus.  One groping hand tries to drag him further.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tears on her face.  She can't watch this.  She TURNS and drops the flowers on Shelly's grave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still too far away to matter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gives it up, his face sinking into the wet grass for a beat before SHELLY'S HAND intrudes INTO FRAME to GRASP his hand. No ethereal glow, no heavenly choir... just a near-dead Eric's blank-faced astonishment, and he moves forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SHELLY'S GRAVE BG She struggles to get her hood up against the rain and roughly wipes the moisture from her face with her sleeve.  She turns toward Eric's grave.  Then, surprised, she looks close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eric is gone.  The white rose lies neatly on the top of the undisturbed  earth there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emphasizing that Elly is now ALONE in the graveyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on Elly, ROSE in the foreground -- She walks OFF.  HOLD the rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A grey day but no rain.  Elly stands wistfully by the window, her doll on standby.  The apartment is in order and perhaps we notice a few new items.  Gabriel the cat, miraculously ALIVE, is sprawled on a chair, licking himself.  Darla BUSTLES INTO FRAME B.G.  Her wardrobe more upscale, her hair done.  Her manner is hectic but natural.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Worktime, kiddo.  First day, new job, gotta go. This does not get the expected smile from Elly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure you're gonna be okay? Elly turns from the window and NODS silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The aforementioned grey day in the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Darla comes up.  Arm around Elly.  Cheer up; he attitude much more connected and loving.  PUSH IN ON ELLY so we know she is clutching SHelly's ring tightly in her hand.  Darla looks past Elly, out the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least it finally stopped raining.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can't rain all the time. Darla kisses Elly on the temple and it out the door.  Elly OPENS her hand to consider the ring.  She looks back out the window -- ANGLE - THE CROW ON THE LEDGE Elly is looking right at it.  Same crow.  We're positive.  So is Elly.  It TAKES WING and flies away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An UP ANGLE from Eric's grave toward the tree as the crow FLIES INTO FRAME and perches there, shucking water.  PUSH IN on the crow.  Watching.  Waiting.
direction.name: direction
